intro: Cousinia shorlughensis, commonly known as the Shorlugh endemic cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Cousinia shorlughensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
